sub_topic: Show that every group of order 20 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C20, the dihedral group D10, or the non-abelian group of order 20.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 20. Determine if G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C20, the dihedral group D10, or the non-abelian group of order 20. Provide a detailed proof for your answer.
message_2:
To determine if G is isomorphic to C20, D10, or a non-abelian group of order 20, we will use the Sylow theorems. The order of G is 20, which can be factored as 2^2 * 5. Thus, we will consider the Sylow 2-subgroups and Sylow 5-subgroups of G.

By the Sylow theorems, the number of Sylow 2-subgroups, denoted by n_2, must divide 5 and be congruent to 1 mod 2. The only possibility for n_2 is 1. This means that there is a unique (and thus normal) Sylow 2-subgroup P of order 4 in G.

Similarly, the number of Sylow 5-subgroups, denoted by n_5, must divide 4 and be congruent to 1 mod 5. The only possibility for n_5 is 1. This means that there is a unique (and thus normal) Sylow 5-subgroup Q of order 5 in G.

Since both P and Q are normal subgroups of G, their intersection is also a normal subgroup of G. However, since the orders of P and Q are coprime (4 and 5), their intersection must be the identity element of G. Therefore, G is the internal direct product of P and Q, i.e., G ≅ P × Q.

Now, P is a group of order 4, so it must be isomorphic to either C4 (the cyclic group of order 4) or V4 (the Klein four-group). Q is a group of order 5, which is prime, so it must be isomorphic to C5 (the cyclic group of order 5).

If P ≅ C4 and Q ≅ C5, then G ≅ C4 × C5. Since the orders of C4 and C5 are coprime, G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C20 by the Chinese Remainder Theorem.

If P ≅ V4 and Q ≅ C5, then G ≅ V4 × C5. In this case, G is isomorphic to the dihedral group D10, as D10 can be constructed as the semi-direct product of V4 and C5.

In conclusion, G must be isomorphic to either the cyclic group C20 or the dihedral group D10. There is no non-abelian group of order 20 that is not isomorphic to D10, so G cannot be isomorphic to a non-abelian group of order 20 other than D10.
